Cab:
Watermark C.a.b. can be distinguished by several features: there is a fleur-de-lis in the arch below the crown, the crown is double banded and the top band contains jewels, and the initials VA or AV can be found below the shield. This watermark is a twinmark with Basel Crosier, C.a.a.

________________________________________________________________________

This watermark can be found on the following prints:

  • The good Samaritan, 1633, (B.90 ii/ NHD 116 ii), British Museum, London (BM 1848-9-11-47). Uncut broadsheet.
  • The good Samaritan, 1633, (B.90 iii/ NHD 116 iii), Biblioth√©que Nationale de France, Paris (BNP B.90iii). Uncut broadsheet.
  • The good Samaritan, 1633, (B.90 iii/ NHD 116 iii), British Museum, London (BM 1973-U.831). Uncut broadsheet.

(Erik Hinterding, Rembrandt as an Etcher, 2006, II, 63)
